questions.text: The internal nasal valve is best defined by which of the following structures?

options.label: A
options.text: Nasal septum, cephalic margin of the upper lateral cartilages, and the nasal floor

options.label: B
options.text: Nasal septum, caudal margin of the upper lateral cartilages, head of the inferior turbinate, and nasal floor

options.label: C
options.text: Nasal septum, mid-portion of the upper lateral cartilages, head of the inferior turbinate, nasal floor, and pyriform aperture

options.label: D
options.text: Nasal floor, head of the inferior turbinate, and head of the middle turbinate

questions.correct_answer: B. Nasal septum, caudal margin of the upper lateral cartilages, head of the inferior turbinate, and nasal floor

questions.text: The radiological presence of which paranasal sinus appears at 6 years of age
Paroxymal sneezing on getting up early in morning from bed is associated with ?
A patient in ENT examination was found to be non responsive to smell of coffee, tea and Asfoetida. He is able to respond to which agent/

A female presented with long standing nasal obstruction. She also complaints about comments from her friends telling about foul smell coming from her nose which she could not recognise. On evaluation, atrophic rhinitis is diagnosed. What can be the etiology in this patient to develop secondary atrophic rhinitis?

A patient of suspected sinusitis has undergone CT scan of sinuses. The radiologist reports an anatomical variation of posterior ethmoid air cell lying in close proximity to optic nerve. Identify the cell?

A 29 year old HIV positive individual presents to emergency in a critical state with deranged vitals. The examination shows a blackish necrotic debris in the nasal cavity with necrosed skin of external nose. What is the best treatment of this patient?
All of the following are true about CSF rhinorrhoea except

options.label: A
options.text: Cribriform plate is the commonest site of leak

options.label: B
options.text: Immediate transnasal endoscopic surgical closure of leak site should be done

options.label: C
options.text: HRCT skull base is the radiological investigation of choice to detect site of leak

options.label: D
options.text: Beta 2 transferrin is helpful in confirmation of diagnosis

questions.correct_answer: B. Immediate transnasal endoscopic surgical closure of leak site should be done

questions.text: A 50 year old female presented with the complaint of nasal obstruction with epistaxis.The CT scan showed a hypodense mass in the nasal cavity at right lateral nasal wall with blockage of the left ethmoid and frontal sinuses. Diagnostic nasal endoscopy showed a reddish brown mass which bleed profusely. Study the given images and comment on the Diagnosis:
For SCC of the sinonasal cavity with skull base invasion, which statement is false?

options.label: A
options.text: Endoscopic skull base approaches may be combined with trans facial approaches to ob tain better tumor visualization and resection.

options.label: B
options.text: Neoadjuvant chemotherapy may have a role in the management of this disease with extensive skull base invasion and is recommended on protocol.

options.label: C
options.text: Proton beam radiation therapy alone has equivalent local control rates compared with conventional surgery.

options.label: D
options.text: Surgery is the mainstay of therapy for tumors

questions.correct_answer: C. Proton beam radiation therapy alone has equivalent local control rates compared with conventional surgery.

questions.text: After laparoscopic appendicectomy, patient had fall from bed on her nose after which she had swelling in nose and difficulty in breathing. Next step in management:

options.label: D
options.text: Discharge after 2 days and follow-up of the patients after 8 weeks

questions.text: Which of the following pairs is incorrect in relation to the evolution of the external ear from the hillocks of His?
Space between pars tensa and anterior malleolar fold is called as:
When making a post auricular incision for mastoid surgery in an infant, the incision should be made more posteriorly than in an adult for which of these reasons?

options.label: A
options.text: The mastoid antrum is located more posteriorly.

options.label: B
options.text: The mastoid is small and the facial nerve may exit directly from the cortex.

options.label: C
options.text: In infants, the emissary vein exits directly out of the mastoid.

options.label: D
options.text: In infants, the blood supply to the pinna may be compromised if the incision is too far anterior.

questions.correct_answer: B. The mastoid is small and the facial nerve may exit directly from the cortex.

questions.text: Which consideration in tympanic-membrane reconstruction is unique to the canal-wall- down scenario?

options.label: A
options.text: Careful planning of ear canal incisions

options.label: B
options.text: Need to palpate and inspect the ossicular chain to assess mobility

options.label: C
options.text: Application of the principles of ossicular and acoustic coupling

options.label: D
options.text: Requirement to directly seal off the anterior epitympanic wall from the supratubal recess and middle ear

questions.correct_answer: D. Requirement to directly seal off the anterior epitympanic wall from the supratubal recess and middle ear

questions.text: All of the following are concerned with auditory pathways except:
All of the following tuning fork tests are used to detect organic hearing loss except:

All of the following are true regarding retrocochlear SNHL except:

A 30- year old woman with family history of hearing loss from her mother’s side developed hearing problem during pregnancy. Hearing loss is bilateral, slowly progressive, Study on the given audiogram and comment on diagnosis ?
Which of the following conditions is associated with cochlear recruitment?
The following procedures are usually performed via a per meatal incision

options.label: A
options.text: Exploration of the vertical portion of the facial nerve.

options.label: D
options.text: Fenestration of the lateral semicircular canal.

questions.correct_answer: B. Membranous labyrinthectomy for Meniere's disease.

questions.text: Which of the following waves on given investigation is the most sensitive to hearing loss?
The genetic transmission of otosclerosis is which of the following?
A retracted tympanic membrane adherent to the promontory is described as:

A 65-year-old patient has a 1-year history of left pulsatile tinnitus. An MRI reveals a brightly enhancing diffuse lesion in the left jugular foramen with multiple flow voids. During surgical resection of this mass, proximal and distal venous control is obtained. Which vessel is most likely to complicate surgical resection of this mass?
Which of the following statements regarding temporal bone fractures involving the otic capsule is incorrect?

options.label: A
options.text: They are generally associated with a sensorineural hearing loss (SNHL).

options.label: B
options.text: They account for 10% to 20% of temporal bone fractures.

options.label: C
options.text: Hemotympanum is the most common cause of hearing loss.

options.label: D
options.text: They are more likely to result in facial nerve palsy than otic capsule–sparing fractures.

questions.correct_answer: C. Hemotympanum is the most common cause of hearing loss.

questions.text: 40 yrs old patient with history of assault presents with loss of hearing,earache and tinnitus. Study the given toposcopic finding and comment on appropriate management

A 7-year-old, otherwise healthy child with a normal otologic examination experiences a unilateral sudden mixed hearing loss documented by pure-tone audiometry. The most appropriate additional study is:

An elderly diabetic male presents with severe pain in the ear. On examination he is found to have granulation in external ear, conductive deafness and facial palsy. He was found to be having increased uptake of Tc99m.Most probable diagnosis is:
Which complication would be expected to occur more often with overlay as compared to underlay tympanoplasty techniques?

options.label: A
options.text: Malleus fixation to the anterior canal wall by scar tissue

options.label: B
options.text: Graft failure due to medial displacement

questions.correct_answer: A. Malleus fixation to the anterior canal wall by scar tissue

questions.text: Patient is having scanty, foul smelling discharge from middle ear, develops fever, headache and neck rigidity.CT of the temporal lobe shows a localized ring enhancing lesion, which of the following is least likely cause of this condition:
Adenoidectomy & Myringotomy with grommet insertion is treatment of choice for?

options.label: A
options.text: Serous otitis media in children with adenoid hypertrophy

options.label: B
options.text: Tubotympanic otitis media in children with adenoid hypertrophy

options.label: C
options.text: Adenoid Hypertrophy in children with atticoantral CSOM

options.label: D
options.text: Children with history of mouth breathing

questions.correct_answer: A. Serous otitis media in children with adenoid hypertrophy

questions.text: A child with severe sensorineural hearing loss (SNHL) presents with fever, headache, nausea and vomiting, and photophobia a day after being diagnosed with acute otitis media (AOM). Temporal bone imaging is most likely to demonstrate:

Which of the following is typically the best choice of amplification for a person with bilateral moderate conductive hearing loss and chronic drainage from both ears?
All of the following are true about cochlear implant except

options.label: A
options.text: Receiver stimulator is surgically implanted inside the body

options.label: B
options.text: Eighth nerve integrity should be established before cochlear implantation

options.label: C
options.text: Mondini’s dysplasia of cochlea is not a contraindication of cochlear implantation

options.label: D
options.text: Veria approach is the classical facial recess approach

questions.correct_answer: D. Veria approach is the classical facial recess approach

questions.text: 30 yrs old female present to ENT OPD with complaint of vertigo for few seconds without any hearing loss. Doctor initially performed a diagnostic maneuver and the try to treat the patient with a therapeutic maneuver, Identify the diagnostic maneuver:

A 12 year-old patient presented with bleeding from ear, pain, tinnitus and increasing deafness. Examination revealed red swelling/mass behind the intact tympanic membrane as shown in given image that blanches on pressure with pneumatic speculum. Treatments for her include all except:
Hennebert sign can be seen in all except
An audiogram of an individual is given below Degree of hearing handicap is ;
Choose the most inappropriate statement regarding investigation shown in the given image

options.label: A
options.text: cVEMP tests saccule and inferior nerve

options.label: B
options.text: cVEMP is an inhibitory potential and an ipsilateral response

options.label: C
options.text: oVEMP is an excitatory response that we record from the extraocular muscles.

options.label: D
options.text: oVEMP is primarily a utricle and inferior nerve response

questions.correct_answer: D. oVEMP is primarily a utricle and inferior nerve response

questions.text: Blood supply to the palatine tonsil is derived from branches of which of the following arteries?
The pathology specimen in a patient with squamous cell carcinoma of the tonsillar fossa without a history of smoking or drinking often is positive for which of the following?

57-year-old male electrician is referred with a 3-month history of worsening dysphonia. Co-morbidities include hypertension. He has smoked 30 cigarettes per day for 40 years and drinks 40 units of alcohol per week. Flexible naso endoscopy reveals a lesion on the left vocal cord. Cord mobility is normal. There are no neck nodes palpable. Direct laryngoscopy at the time of biopsy is shown as follows. Least common site of underlying malignancy is
Which of the following would cause a characteristic “washing machine” type of stridor?

options.label: C
options.text: Vascular ring, bilateral VFP, vallecular cyst

questions.correct_answer: B. Tracheomalacia, tracheal stenosis, vascular ring

questions.text: In the postoperative care of tracheostomy

options.label: A
options.text: Accidental decannulation after 2 weeks should be treated as an emergency.

options.label: B
options.text: Copious mucus production indicates a pulmonary infection.

options.label: C
options.text: A poorly positioned tracheostomy tube may produce a fatal haemorrhage.

options.label: D
options.text: Prolapsed cuff is the commonest causes of obstruction.

questions.correct_answer: C. A poorly positioned tracheostomy tube may produce a fatal haemorrhage.

questions.text: Which voice disorder would be the least amenable to voice therapy?
Which of the following is true of diagnostic testing of laryngopharyngeal reflux (LPR)?

options.label: A
options.text: A 24-hour dual-probe pH testing is highly effective at identifying those with acid reflux.

options.label: B
options.text: Presence of esophagitis on esophagoscopy is necessary to diagnose LPR.

options.label: C
options.text: A positive response to acid-suppressive therapy is diagnostic of LPR.

options.label: D
options.text: Demonstration of abnormal lower esophageal sphincter (LES) pressures on manom- etry is diagnostic of LPR.

questions.correct_answer: A. A 24-hour dual-probe pH testing is highly effective at identifying those with acid reflux.

questions.text: The rate of failed emergency department intubations and subsequent surgical airway management is approximately between:
Which of the following is not true about supraglottic malignancy?

options.label: B
options.text: Epiglottis is the most common site

questions.correct_answer: C. Metastatic cervical lymphadenopathy is uncommon

questions.text: In a patient of acute epiglottitis, all of the following are part of management except

options.label: D
options.text: Repeat direct laryngoscopy every hour to assess laryngeal edema

questions.correct_answer: D. Repeat direct laryngoscopy every hour to assess laryngeal edema

questions.text: You are injecting botulinum toxin in a patient with vocal tremor. Which of the following ing statements describes the disease and treatment options?

options.label: A
options.text: With the correct dose, the tremor will completely disappear.

options.label: B
options.text: Toxin injections will dampen but not eliminate the tremor.

options.label: C
options.text: Patients injected for vocal tremor never get dysphagia as a side effect.

options.label: D
options.text: Medications work well for vocal tremor and should be used instead of toxin injections.

questions.correct_answer: B. Toxin injections will dampen but not eliminate the tremor.

questions.text: Which of the following best describes vocal fold granuloma? 1. Is often related to recent endotracheal intubation 2. Occurs at the vocal process of the arytenoid cartilage 3. Involves caseating nodules on histology 4. Can often be a recurrent problem
Recurrent respiratory papillomatosis (RRP) demonstrates a predilection for which of the following sites?

options.label: A
options.text: Junction of ciliated and squamous epithelium

options.label: B
options.text: The undersurface of the vocal folds

questions.text: 5 year old child presented to ENT OPD with the chief complaint of hoarseness of voice for last 6 months which is progressively increasing in severity. There is no history of vocal abuse. What is the most probable diagnosis?
Laryngeal videostroboscopy helps to differentiate benign from early malignant lesions of vocal cord by

options.label: A
options.text: Identifying the mobility of vocal cord

options.label: B
options.text: Identification of preservation of normal mucosal wave of vocal cord

options.label: D
options.text: Malignant lesions are seen in blue color

questions.correct_answer: B. Identification of preservation of normal mucosal wave of vocal cord

questions.text: A case of carcinoma larynx with the involvement of Left vocal cord, left aryepiglottic fold, left ventricular band and invading into paraglottic space. Which of the following statements is true for the managements of this case?
Which of the following describes Type III cordectomy correctly?
Which of the following is not true about vocal rehabilitation of laryngectomised patient—

options.label: A
options.text: Esophageal voice has high quality voice and very good success rate

options.label: C
options.text: Blom -singer prosthesis is surgically fitted between trachea and esophagus

options.label: D
options.text: The dynamic segment in esophageal speech is pharyngo-oesophageal segment

questions.correct_answer: A. Esophageal voice has high quality voice and very good success rate

questions.text: A 3 month old child has developed persistent dyspnoea and stridor since birth. On CT scan of neck, the subglottic diameter has been found to be 2.5 mm. Subsequently , the child has been operated and a silicon tube has been placed in the airway. What is the name of this tube?
All of the following are true about acute retropharyngeal abscess except

options.label: A
options.text: Examination of pharynx shows a midline bulge on posterior pharyngeal wall

options.label: B
options.text: Mostly presents as a paediatric airway emergency

options.label: C
options.text: X ray soft tissue neck lateral view shows widening of prevertebral shadow

options.label: D
options.text: Retropharyngeal space extends from skull base to bifurcation of trachea

questions.correct_answer: A. Examination of pharynx shows a midline bulge on posterior pharyngeal wall
